title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Dozens of Massachusetts school districts, including Boston and Cambridge, are closed on Monday, Feb. 23 due to snow.
The closures are part of preparations for a major snowstorm affecting the New England region.
Residents are encouraged to email [email protected] if their school's closure is not listed.

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Fall River police search for Kyron Simmons, 36, accused of shooting and killing a dog on Feb. 3.
Simmons faces charges including home invasion, firearm discharge, animal killing, and reckless child endangerment.
Police executed a search warrant at Simmons's residence, finding firearm accessories; he is believed armed and dangerous.

title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dedham Animal Control reported a bobcat sighting near Deerpath Road and Route 109 last week.
Residents are advised to eliminate outdoor food sources and supervise pets to coexist safely with wildlife.
Animal control says bobcat sightings increase during mating season; report sick or aggressive animals promptly.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Manager Alex Cora previews Boston Red Sox's 2026 Opening Day lineup with Roman Anthony and Trevor Story leading off.
Roman Anthony will be the leadoff hitter, returning from a 2025 injury with a previous batting average of .336 in that role.
Isiah Kiner-Falefa secures a lineup spot over Marcelo Mayer, with Mayer needing to prove himself in spring training.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts expects up to 2 feet of snow; power outages likely due to high winds and heavy, wet snow.
Boston shelters open all night for homeless; Pine Street Inn to run outreach vans during the storm.
MBTA operates on reduced schedule; ferry services suspended in response to the nor’easter.

title: Bruins react to McAvoy, Swayman’s gold-medal win over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman won Olympic gold with Team USA, ending a 46-year drought for the men's hockey team.
McAvoy played a key defensive role, featuring in crucial moments despite not scoring during the tournament.
The Bruins celebrated their teammates' success as Team USA's victory boosts morale for their NHL season return.

title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have the 31st pick in the 2026 NFL Draft, focusing on offensive linemen or edge rushers.
NFL Network's Daniel Jeremiah suggests Zion Young, Missouri EDGE, as a fit for Patriots' defensive needs.
Yahoo Sports' Charles McDonald predicts Patriots selecting Oregon TE Kenyon Sadiq for his strong pass-catching skills.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey defeated Canada 2-1 in overtime, winning their first Olympic Gold since 1980.
Jack Hughes scored the game-winning goal in overtime, securing victory for the U.S. in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Goalie Connor Hellebuyck made 41 saves, playing a pivotal role in the Americans' gold-medal win over Canada.

title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution started the 2026 MLS season with a 4-1 loss to Nashville SC at Geodis Park.
Key defenders Brayan Ceballos, Mamadou Fofana, and Peyton Miller were absent, testing New England's defensive depth.
Coach Marko Mitrović faced criticism for lineup choices, notably benching defender Ilay Feingold and starting Ethan Kohler.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station have malfunctioned twice since opening, due to harsh winter conditions.
The gates, costing $3.3 million, were closed following a January storm and have been affected by wind and snow.
Despite issues, MBTA reports a 42% increase in mTicket activations since the gates' implementation last year.
